org.jtrim2.taskgraph.basic

Class DirectedGraph<N>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim2.taskgraph.basic.DirectedGraph<N>
  • Type Parameters:
    N - the type of the node. The nodes are distinguished based on their equals.

    public final class DirectedGraph<N>
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a directed graph without any solitary nodes. That is, this class only defines the edges in a directed graph and cannot define nodes without part of an edge.

    An instance of DirectedGraph via its DirectedGraph.Builder.

    Thread safety

    Instances of DirectedGraph are immutable (assuming the nodes themselves are immutable) and so can be used safely by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of DirectedGraph are synchronization transparent.

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DirectedGraph.Builder<N>
      The Builder used to create DirectedGraph instances.
      static interface  DirectedGraph.ChildrenBuilder<N>
      Defines a builder to add children to a particular node in the graph.

    • Method Detail

      • checkNotCyclic

        public void checkNotCyclic()
        Checks if this graph is acyclic or not, throwing an exception if this graph is not acyclic.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - thrown if this graph is not acyclic.

      • getReachableNodes

        public java.util.Set<N> getReachableNodes(java.lang.Iterable<? extends N> nodes)
        Returns all the nodes reachable from any of the nodes given in the argument. That is, a node is returned, if, and only, if there is directed path from any of nodes given in the argument to it.

        If this directed graph contains no edges from or to a node provided in the argument, it is assumed that the given node is separate node but part of the graph. That is, the nodes passed in the arguments will always be part of the returned set.

        Parameters:
        nodes - the nodes from which the returned nodes are reached from. This argument cannot be null and may not contain null elements.
        Returns:
        all the nodes reachable from any of the nodes given in the argument. This method never returns null.

      • getAllLeafToRootNodes

        public java.util.Map<N,java.util.Set<N>> getAllLeafToRootNodes(java.lang.Iterable<? extends N> rootNodes)
        Returns a map, mapping the leaf nodes (nodes having no children) to nodes they are reachable where the image of the mapping only contains nodes specified in the argument. If multiple leaf nodes are reachable from a particular node, that particular node will be listed under all the reachable leaf nodes.

        The nodes from which a particular leaf is reachable are listed in the same order as they appear in the node list given in the argument.

        There will not be entry in the map for leaf nodes not reachable from any of the given nodes.

        Performance note: The getAllLeafToRootNodes of DependencyDag usually has a much better performance if the number of passed root nodes is large.

        Parameters:
        rootNodes - the nodes to be considered from where leaf nodes are reachable from. This argument cannot be null and may not contain null elements.
        Returns:
        a map, mapping the leaf nodes (nodes having no children) to nodes they are reachable where the image of the mapping only contains nodes specified in the argument. This method never returns null.
        See Also:
        DependencyDag.getAllLeafToRootNodes(java.lang.Iterable<? extends N>), DependencyDag.getAllLeafToRootNodesOrdered(java.lang.Iterable<? extends N>)

      • getAllLeafToRootNodes

        public java.util.Map<N,java.util.Set<N>> getAllLeafToRootNodes(java.lang.Iterable<? extends N> rootNodes,
                                                               java.util.function.Supplier<? extends java.util.Set<N>> newSetFactory)
        Returns a map, mapping the leaf nodes (nodes having no children) to nodes they are reachable where the image of the mapping only contains nodes specified in the argument. If multiple leaf nodes are reachable from a particular node, that particular node will be listed under all the reachable leaf nodes.

        The nodes from which a particular leaf is reachable will be added to the image sets in the same order as they appear in the node list given in the argument.

        There will not be entry in the map for leaf nodes not reachable from any of the given nodes.

        Performance note: The getAllLeafToRootNodes of DependencyDag usually has a much better performance if the number of passed root nodes is large.

        Parameters:
        rootNodes - the nodes to be considered from where leaf nodes are reachable from. This argument cannot be null and may not contain null elements.
        newSetFactory - a factory creating a empty, mutable sets for the result map. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        a map, mapping the leaf nodes (nodes having no children) to nodes they are reachable where the image of the mapping only contains nodes specified in the argument. This method never returns null.

      • getRawGraph

        public java.util.Map<N,java.util.Set<N>> getRawGraph()
        Returns a map, mapping parent nodes to their direct children. The returned map does not contain mapping for nodes having no children.

        The returned map cannot be modified.

        Returns:
        a map, mapping parent nodes to their direct children. This method never returns null.

      • getChildren

        public java.util.Set<N> getChildren(N node)
        Returns the set of direct children of the given node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node whose children are to be returned. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the set of direct children of the given node. This method never returns null, if the node has no children, an empty set is returned.

      • hasChildren

        public boolean hasChildren(N node)
        Returns true if the given node has at least one child node, false otherwise. That is, this method returns true, if and only, if the given node is not a leaf node.

        This method is effectively equivalent to: 

         !getChildren(node).isEmpty()
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be checked. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        true if the given node has at least one child node, false otherwise

      • reverseGraph

        public DirectedGraph<N> reverseGraph()
        Returns a DirectedGraph where the edges a reversed compared to this graph.
        Returns:
        a DirectedGraph where the edges a reversed compared to this graph. This method never returns null.
